intro: Pisonia fragrans, commonly known as the sweet shower or fragrant pisonia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant produces small, red berries that are edible but often have a bitter taste. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a glossy texture. Pisonia fragrans thrives in coastal areas and is often found in tropical and subtropical climates.
